title: Château de Landiras 2017 Barrel Sample  (Graves)
description: 86–88. Barrel Sample. This wine is soft and gently fruity, with some attractive acidity to lift the almond and spice flavors. It is rounded and will age quickly; drink from 2020.

title: Château la Croix de Pez 2017 Barrel Sample  (Saint-Estèphe)
description: 86–88. Barrel Sample. From one of the many estates in Saint-Estèphe that have added the hamlet of Pez to their name, this wine already hints at over-use of wood. The only inkling of fruit is in the acidity at the end.

title: Drink Washington State 2015 Welcome to Columbia Valley Chardonnay (Columbia Valley (WA))
description: Bright, pleasant aromas of yellow apple, pear and papaya lead to a palate chock full of tropical-fruit flavors. It finishes a little tangy.

title: Elton 2015 Chardonnay (Eola-Amity Hills)
description: Elton is a new label under the Willamette Valley Vineyards umbrella, though the vineyard has been a favored designate for the past decade. This latest release falls a little short. The barrel flavors of buttered nuts have a slightly oily mouthfeel, and the apple and orange fruit is only moderately ripened. It seems to promise more than it delivers, given the packaging and price.

title: Fattoria Del Cerro 2014  Vino Nobile di Montepulciano
description: Underbrush, violet, aromatic herb and wild berry aromas appear at the forefront. The light-bodied palate is less expressive, showing dried blackberry and clove alongside dusty tannins.

title: Flowers 2015 Seaview Ridge Pinot Noir (Sonoma Coast)
description: Exotically floral, this wine is extreme in spicy acidity and robust earthiness, a mix of rose petal, citrus and black tea that struggles somewhat to find balance and fruit.

title: Gva'ot 2016 Dances In White White (Shomron)
description: A nose of honeydew melon and vanilla bean set the stage for flavors of apple, nectarine and hazelnut. This wine is full on the palate, with closing notes of citrus fruit and a hint of toasted nuts.

title: James Charles 2016 Cuvée de la Reine White (Virginia)
description: This blend of Riesling, Vidal Blanc and Seyval Blanc has soft aromas of elderflower, lemon, wet stone and dried apple. Zippy acidity tingles on the palate and lends itself to a long finish full of minerality.

title: Johan 2014 Three Barrel Pinot Noir (Willamette Valley)
description: This wine is made from three barrels were chosen for their particular aroma and flavor characteristics. It carries aggressive, spicy cranberry flavors and searing acidity that cuts the palate short. Drink now.

title: José Maria da Fonseca 2016 JMF Branco White (Península de Setúbal)
description: Attractively perfumed Moscatel in the blend of this wine adds a touch of spice to the crisp Fernão Pires. The combination is immediately attractive, ripe while keeping plenty of crispness. Drink this wine now.

title: Karl Kaspar 2016 Kabinett Riesling (Mosel)
description: Exuberantly fruity and forward, this light-footed kabinett offers loads of sweet, juicy tangerine, grapefruit and berry flavors. It's not a complex wine but approachable and easy drinking, with a clean mineral finish.

title: Lubanzi 2015 Red (Coastal Region)
description: This playful, easy-drinking blend of 46% Shiraz, 31% Cinsault, 20% Mourvèdre and 3% Grenache is ripe and fruit-forward, offering oodles of black plum, cherry and currant tones that are hit by accents of blackcurrant leaf and bramble. The juicy palate boasts soft tannins and bright acidity, resulting in a clean, mouthwatering finish. Drink now–2019.

title: Maison Bouey 2015 Château Maison Blanche  (Médoc)
description: From a chateau owned by the Bouey Bordeaux negociant family, this wine is ripe, rich and soft. Its tannic structure gives just-enough support to the attractive red-currant and berry fruits. Drink this forward, fruity wine from 2020.

title: Maryhill 2014 Merlot (Columbia Valley (WA))
description: Aromas of mint, woodspice, raspberry and coffee are followed by ripe red-currant flavors. Soft, lightly grainy tannins provide support. It has good things going on and is varietally correct but seems a bit woody.

title: Maysara 2016 Anahita Riesling (McMinnville)
description: Dry and astringent, this is remarkably similar to a hard cider. Half was fermented in stainless steel, half in concrete, and it is the concrete that comes out in the aromatics, much more than fruit. For food pairing, look to the sorts of things that would accompany a good cider.

title: Merriman 2014 Cummins Road Pinot Noir (Yamhill-Carlton)
description: From Dijon clones, this shows dried cranberries and a touch of leather. The finish seems a bit attenuated also. Two bottles were tasted; the second a little less leathery, but with comparable fruit.

title: Methven Family Vineyards 2014 Jill Marie Pinot Noir (Eola-Amity Hills)
description: The least expensive of the winery's Pinots, this has a light and fruity style that makes it instantly approachable. Simple red-berry flavors, crisp acids and a little crunch to the tannins give it some extra depth.

title: Meyer-Fonné 2016 Vieilles Vignes Pinot Blanc (Alsace)
description: An earthy overtone sits on the nose. The palate has a similarly earthy ring but adds gentle pear and lemon notes to a very light, dry body.

title: Mignanelli 2015 Pinot Noir (Central Coast)
description: Light rose buds, dried potpourri and tart cranberry aromas show on the nose of this appellation blend. The palate is a touch thin but with decent grip, and delivers easily likable flavors of cranberry and cinnamon.

title: Mocali 2016  Maremma Toscana
description: Made entirely with Cabernet Sauvignon, this opens with aromas of dark-skinned fruit and scorched earth. The straightforward palate offers vanilla, blackberry jam and cedar alongside round tannins.

title: Oak Grove 2016 Family Reserve Petite Sirah (California)
description: This wine is very fruity in flavor and almost sleek in texture, but still has the varietal's typical firm tannins and hints of black pepper in the generous black-cherry flavors. It's medium bodied, not too heavy or too astringent, so it will be more versatile than many.

title: Olivini 2011 Brut Metodo Classico  (Lugana)
description: Aromas of toasted nut, bread crust and a whiff of grilled rosemary lead the nose. The aromas carry over to the palate along with yellow apple skin and a hint of coffee while brisk acidity gives it a rather lean finish.

title: Pali 2016 Riviera Pinot Noir (Sonoma Coast)
description: Earthy forest and mushroom belie a hearty, dense and velvety expression of rich dark cherry and huckleberry in this full-bodied powerful wine.

title: Paniole 2016 L'Artista  (Maremma Toscana)
description: This blend of 80% Sangiovese and 20% Merlot opens with aromas of baking spice and red plum. It's straightforward, with strawberry jam, orange peel and vanilla flavors alongside supple tannins.

title: Perelada 2016 Només Garnacha Blanca (Empordà)
description: Aromas of orange peel, melon and vanilla come together fairly well. This feels plump but solid, with modest acidity. Melony flavors turn yeasty on a lightly oxidized finish that lacks length and kick. Drink now.

title: Phelps Creek 2014 Upper East Slope Dijon 115 Clone Pinot Noir (Columbia Gorge (OR))
description: Despite the extra years in bottle, this wine has not really come together. Somewhat awkward and astringent, it pushes stiff berry fruits against drying tannins. Sometimes blending is a better approach than focusing too specifically on a single block and clone.

title: Phelps Creek 2016 Le Petit Pinot Noir (Columbia Gorge (OR))
description: This entry-level, simple yet well-made wine offers straightforward cranberry and cherry fruit. It's fresh and bright, with juicy youthful appeal. Drink now while it's at its freshest.

title: Polvanera 2016 Bianco Minutolo (Puglia)
description: Made from the regional grape of unknown origins, Minutolo, this wine is not bashful with its heady floral and fruity nature. Ripe tropical fruit, grapefruit and white flower tones carry the nose and palate. This is medium in weight with a delightfully astringent texture that helps maintain balance.

title: Preiss-Zimmer 2016 Réserve Pinot Blanc (Alsace)
description: A touch of cream joins the pear note on the nose. The palate, however, has a main theme of fresh lemon on a slender, dry body. Drink soon.

title: Quinta de Chocapalha 2015 Mar de Lisboa Red (Lisboa)
description: The ocean is never far away in all wines from the Lisboa region. The crispness and the bright red fruits of this open wine testify to that fact. This is a light wine, full of fruit, delicious now and ready to drink.
